newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutsche says implements new sick-pay law.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche says implements new sick-pay law.

text.p: Germany's largest commercial bank, Deutsche Bank AG, said on Thursday it has implemented a new national law that allows companies to cut sick-pay benefits to workers.
A bank spokesman said the new law, which went into effect on Tuesday and cuts sick-pay benefits to 80 percent of gross wages from 100 percent, affects about 40,000 of the bank's workers in Germany.
Deutsche's global workforce totals about 72,000 people.
Workers at the bank will be able to use holiday time to offset the lost wages, the spokesman said.
Deutsche Bank's rival, Commerzbank AG, has previously said it would implement the new sick-pay laws.
The new law has caused labour unrest particularly in the car industry, and German banking unions have said banks face warning strikes if they implement it.
